title: Parents' fears over sexting and abuse among teenagers
description: A mother and a father reveal their shock at learning of their children's experiences of online sex.

title: Amy Winehouse: Could there be new music on the way?
description: Ten years after her death, Amy's parents say they want fans to hear CDs of her unreleased material.

title: Trading sex for cosmetic surgery in Mexico's narco capital
description: The influence of narcos has caused many women to undergo cosmetic surgery in Mexico's Sinaloa state.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Japanese artists reimagine countries as anime samurai
description: The creators have used the flags of competing nations as inspiration to design Japanese warriors.

title: What does a future-proofed home look like?
description: The technology exists to make homes more resilient to extreme weather, but it can be expensive.

title: Coronavirus: Was US money used to fund risky research in China?
description: What's the row about virus research in China between a prominent Republican and Dr Anthony Fauci?

title: The cost of hosting the Olympics
description: Holding the world's biggest sporting event comes with a hefty price tag

title: The refugee athlete who lost his mum to Covid
description: Abdullah Sediqi, 24, is competing at the Tokyo Games in her honour.

title: The Hundred - Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals: Watch highlights of the first men's Hundred match
description: Watch the best moments from the opening match of the men's Hundred, as Oval Invincibles beat the Manchester Originals.

title: Emily Ratajkowski sponsors Bantry Basketball Club in County Cork
description: Emily Ratajkowski buys kit for Bantry's U15 and U16 teams, setting Snapchat "on fire".

title: Pilot praises RAF Lakenheath plane spotter for saving his life
description: Ian Simpson alerts an airbase after seeing sparks and flames coming from the rear of a jet.

title: Post Office scandal: What the Horizon saga is all about
description: The background to the cases of sub-postmasters whose convictions were based on evidence from faulty IT.

title: Greensill had extraordinarily privileged access to government, says inquiry
description: Financier Lex Greensill used his government role as a "marketing platform" for his firm, a report says.

title: English football 'at genuine risk', says chair of fan-led review
description: The dangers facing English league clubs are "very real", with key aspects of the nation's game "at genuine risk", says the chair of a fan-led review commissioned by the government.

title: Croydon tram crash: Passengers accidentally killed, jury finds
description: Seven people died when the tram tipped over and spun off the track in Croydon in November 2016.

title: Olympics opening ceremony director sacked for Holocaust joke
description: The decision to remove Kentaro Kobayashi comes a day before the opening show is due to be held.

title: Covid: Panic buying discouraged amid new pingdemic peak
description: Supermarkets tell people not to panic buy as the NHS Covid app pings more people than ever before.

title: Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony: Hannah Mills and rower Mohamed Sbihi to be Team GB flag bearers
description: Sailor Hannah Mills and rower Mohamed Sbihi are chosen to carry the flag for Great Britain at Friday's Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony.

title: More than 600,000 people told to isolate by app last week
description: 618,903 people in England and Wales received self-isolation alerts in the week up to 14 July

title: Australia and NZ pull out of Rugby League World Cup
description: Australia and New Zealand pull out of the Rugby League World Cup because of "player welfare and safety concerns" related to the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Mexico stun France with 4-1 win - highlights
description: Watch highlights as Mexico win their opening match of Tokyo 2020, comfortably beating France 4-1 at the Tokyo Stadium.

title: Mercury Prize nominations: Wolf Alice, Arlo Parks and Celeste make the shortlist
description: The band are joined by Arlo Parks, Celeste, Ghetts and Mogwai on the album of the year shortlist.

title: Tokyo Olympics: I beat an Olympian... when I was younger
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat speaks to people who can boast they once beat some of the current Team GB.

title: Lone women in Covid quarantine hotels to get female guards
description: The government is responding to continuing complaints of sexual harassment in hotel quarantine.

title: Pegasus spyware seller: Blame our customers not us for hacking
description: NSO Group tells BBC News: "The finger-pointing should be at the customer."

title: China floods: Drone footage shows the scale of damage as clean up begins
description: As aerial pictures show the extent of destruction, our correspondent reports on the situation on the ground.

title: John Coates: Australian Olympic boss in awkward 'mansplaining' row
description: In an awkward exchange, John Coates ordered politician Annastacia Palaszczuk to attend the Olympics.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith opens up on body image & tackling racism in sport
description: Dina Asher-Smith opens up about life on and off the track with friend and Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo.

title: Polly Swann: Olympic rower on working the wards, training in her shed & unfinished business
description: BBC Scotland speaks to Olympic rower Polly Swann on juggling training for Tokyo with working in a surgical ward in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Bradley Lowery: Building a legacy for the Sunderland fan
description: Bradley's mother Gemma explains how her charity is building a holiday home for children with illnesses.

title: The Hundred begins with fireworks, DJs and a brilliant match on opening night
description: The Hundred begins with fireworks, DJs and live music but, most importantly, a young crowd is captivated by a thrilling opening game.

title: Nottingham maternity scandal: 'The pain never goes away'
description: More than 20 families demand a completely independent inquiry into an NHS trust's failing maternity services.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith on the Olympics, Vogue, and speaking out against injustice
description: In an interview with Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo for BBC Sport, Dina Asher-Smith talks Olympics, body positivity and speaking out against injustice.

title: Eating disorders: The terrible impact of the pandemic on the young
description: Admissions soared during the pandemic, and NHS bosses warn they are running out of beds.

title: Joe Biden says he's self-conscious as president
description: The president reflects on his first six months in the White House in a town hall hosted in Ohio.

title: 'I thought rape isn't something that happens to men'
description: Support charities say male victims of sexual assault sometimes feel their experiences don't count.

title: Anne-Marie: I've always loved the idea of revenge
description: The pop star on beating anxiety, growing bored of her biggest song, and her revenge fantasies.
